results.title: Executive Assistant
results.description:
About the role: 

Our Executive Assistant will work closely with the COO and leadership team on multiple day-to-day aspects of the business.

We are looking for someone who:

  • Lives for the thrill of administration. Preparing documentation, note taking, and follow ups are a genuine joy in your work life.

  • Is a meticulous calendar manager and analyzer. You thrive helping others make the most of their time and know how to coach them in the right direction.

  • Is especially excited about the prospect of supporting enterprise sales administration throughout deal lifecycles. You'd love to get your hands into customized sales decks, bespoke commercials and contracts.

  • Can keep a CRM database up to date. You believe that enabling others using accurate and timely data is a simple way to unblock progress.

  • Dives into novel projects with enthusiasm. New opportunities excite you and you see failure as a learning strategy.

  • Demonstrates project management capabilities to ensure projects are on time and within budget. 

 

About you:

  • You are the most resourceful person you know by a mile

  • You are wildly conscientious, proactive, and take initiative; nothing slips through the cracks

  • You excel in a highly rational environment

  • You don’t shy away from accountability and are confident owning projects you have no experience with

  • You have high integrity and are comfortable with vulnerability

  • You know your value and feel confident managing up to senior leaders

 

Qualifications:

  • An undergraduate degree in Business, Commerce, Entrepreneurship or related field

  • 3-5 years as an Executive Assistant to the C-Suite

  • Additional experience in a client-facing role, such as business development or sales would be ideal as this role will support a revenue-side co-founder

  • Startup experience preferred, especially Series A or Series B maturity

 

Good to Know:

  • It would be ideal if you lived somewhere around the Greater Toronto Area, Hamilton, or Kitchener-Waterloo so you can occasionally work IRL with leadership, but really, anywhere in the Eastern Time Zone works for us.

 

Compensation:

  • $80,000-$104,500 salary

  • $37,250-$43,000 in stock options

  • WFH stipend, wellness stipend, and other programs to encourage holistic wellness.

  • 3 weeks paid vacation + one week shut down at the end of the year

 

Disclaimer:

We are only prepared to hire candidates currently living in Canada and the United States and are unable to consider other international applicants.

 

Your location of employment will be your home office, however you will be expected to travel within North America roughly once per quarter to effectively carry out your responsibilities.

results.title: Chief of Staff, OpenSSF
results.description:
Company Description

The Linux Foundation is the organization of choice for the world's top developers and companies to build ecosystems that accelerate open technology development and commercial adoption. Together with the worldwide open source community, it is solving the hardest technology problems by creating the largest shared technology investment in history.

Today, the Linux Foundation has over 2,000 corporate members from over 41 countries, including every single one the Fortune 100. The Linux Foundation has proudly created over $54B in shared technology value since inception.



Job Description

OpenSSF’s mission is to advance open source security for all by working collaboratively with upstream and existing communities. Our projects and initiatives are focused on securing the open source supply chain and promoting secure development best practices for everyone. We use our Technical Vision and our Values to guide discussion, decision making, and delivery for all our programs.

We are seeking a Chief of Staff to help us execute on our purpose alongside our member organizations, working groups and community leaders. You’ll work side-by-side with these stakeholders, as well as the program management team and other Linux Foundation teams to meaningfully and measurably execute on goals, and cultivate new and existing relationships to their fullest potential. Most importantly, you’ll work closely with the General Manager, to whom you will report.

Salary Range: $175k-$300k

 

Job Role And Responsibilities

As part of the OpenSSF leadership team, you’ll work with staff, governing board members, and the larger OpenSSF community to map the priorities and goals of the foundation to an effective deployment of the financial and talent contributions. Your work will drive improved communication and efficiency across the organization’s many working groups, projects, member organizations, and strategic partnerships.

 Key responsibilities include:

  • Collaborating with the General Manager, Governing Board members, and other stakeholders to determine, document, and prioritize business strategies

  • Acting as a thought partner to the GM for new ideas and initiatives.

  • Managing the organization’s schedule of events, important deadlines, and significant project timelines

  • Leading the OKR development process for the organization and determining key performance indicators and how to measure performance

  • Working with teammates to deliver, monitor and communicate progress towards goals

  • Overseeing strategic initiatives from ideation to implementation

  • Identifying and helping solve core problems or opportunities within established processes, and providing feedback to optimize community processes

  • Providing support and oversight for special projects and initiatives

  • Planning, coordinating and leading staff meetings and workshops

  • Identifying and providing recommendations on process improvements across the organization

  • Work with OpenSSF staff and community members to summarize and report out on the activities and impact of the organization in a way suitable for both internal and external audiences.

  • Responding to inquiries on behalf of the General Manager, assisting them to maintain open lines of communication with current and potential member organizations and strategic partners

  • Make occasional public presentations on the goals, activities, and impact of the project. 



Qualifications

Required Skills

  • Strong oral and written communication skills: you write down action items, follow up with meeting notes, and have a penchant for documenting process and goals

  • Strong cooperative leadership skills: you understand the nuances required when working with volunteers, and that our mandate is to serve

  • Strong problem solving skills: you aren’t afraid of a little ambiguity, a hard problem, or a sticky situation and work productively to resolve issues

  • Operational focus: you plan, coordinate, get sign off, prep documents and set agendas to help keep everyone in alignment. 

  • Demonstrated ability to understand, operate, and clearly communicate in a complex, multi-stakeholder environment.

  • Experience working with open source communities: you understand the open source ecosystem and the challenges and opportunities it faces



Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

The Linux Foundation is creating the greatest shared technology investment in history by enabling open source collaboration across companies, developers, and users. We are the organization of choice to build ecosystems that accelerate open technology development and commercial adoption.

The Linux Foundation is an all-remote workforce that hires world-class talent.  We are as passionate about providing a flexible and supportive work culture as we are about open-source software. Collaboration is in our DNA, and we pride ourselves on being able to work closely together while not being tied to an office. We offer exceptional benefits - e.g., top of the line healthcare plans, unlimited PTO, and 100% 401k match up to the IRS-defined limit per year.

The Linux Foundation is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

results.title: Business Analyst
results.description:
Mind Computing is seeking a Sr. Business Analyst to join our growing team in support of the Department of Veteran Affairs, specifically the Financial Services Center (FSC). The FSC serves customers internally at the VA and other government agencies (OGA).

The candidate must reside within the continental US.

Responsibilities:

  • Extensive knowledge of business processes and system
    analysis, design, improvement, and implementation efforts, and in translating business process needs into technical requirements.
  • Provide expertise in change management and training support.
  • Provide organizational and strategic planning for a wide variety of technical and functional environments.
  • Provide expertise in the following areas, including but not limited to, Configuration Management, Strategic
    Planning, Knowledge Management, Business Analysis, and Technical Analysis.
  • Analytically and systematically evaluates problems, workflows, and organizations and develops appropriate plans of action.
  • Applies business process improvement practices to business process modernization projects.
  • Perform process design and improvement work under the direction of Government resources.
  • Plan discovery assessments; improvement or design planning (to include recommendations for appropriate process improvement and design methodologies), proposing and defining performance metrics, developing and implementing measurement plans, performing As-Is and To-Be analysis (including workflow maps), developing courses of action for government consideration, and implementation of selected actions.
  • Develop and manage implementation plans, SOPs based on Government identified processes, development, and delivery of training materials, and development of communications products.
  • Provide process improvement/design plans that include methodology recommendations; Discovery analysis that includes problem statement definition, scope definition, high-level process mapping, AS-IS/TO-BE documentation, and measurement plans; improvement recommendations for current performance assessments, root cause analysis, and To-Be Analysis; Implementation planning including development and testing plans, change management plans, and training plans; implemented solutions including SOPs, process documentation, training materials, and communications; and control assessment including post-implementation performance analysis and retrospectives.

Requirements:

  • A bachelor's degree in Analysis, a technical discipline, or any other relevant discipline is required.
  • A minimum of 7 years of analyst experience is required.
  • Ability to rapidly prioritize competing requirements.
  • Ability to communicate end-user feedback to technical and design leads.
  • Strong understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC).
  • Process improvement/process design practices, such as six sigma, lean, total quality management, and theory of constraints.

Additional Qualifications:

  • Experience working on federal government projects.
  • Ability to obtain a government clearance.
  • Experience supporting the Veterans Health Administration.

Benefits:

  • Medical/Dental/Vision
  • PTO + Federal Holidays  + Sick Leave
  • Corporate Laptop 
  • Training opportunities  
  • Remote work options

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Sorry, we are unable to offer sponsorship at this time.

results.title: Executive Assistant
results.description:
** NOTE: Applications can only be accepted through our website at https://gideon300.breezy.hr **

Gideon300 is a high-impact public relations agency representing leaders who stand for America's founding principles.

We are looking for a mission and detail-driven Executive Assistant excited about the opportunity to assist an elite PR company in its operations. The role and the company is 100% remote with great potential for growth.

ABOUT US

Our founder, Matthew Faraci, is a well-known entrepreneur, producer, public relations expert, former political strategist and former TV host.

Faraci has been involved in a number of high-profile, successful ventures including his previous role as Executive Producer of The Chosen—the #1 crowdfunded media project in history—as a producer on the animated kids TV series The Tuttle Twins, as host, for two seasons, of his own TV series on Dove Channel, and most importantly, as founder of the highly-respected public relations agency Inspire Buzz...and now a growing sister agency called Gideon300.

His PR agencies have successfully represented cause-driven clients ranging from popular startups to Fortune 100 companies who have appeared in top media outlets including Newsmax, Fox News, The Washington Times, The Daily Wire, TBN's Huckabee, Glenn Beck, The Epoch Times, Christian Broadcasting Network, The Eric Metaxas Show, Salem Radio Networks, and so many others.

Our clients are demanding and the conservative media world is fast-paced, but we are full of energy and have a passion for the work we do. In this work, we strive for excellence, not perfection and value each team member's contribution.

THE POSITION

The EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT plays a key support role to the president of an elite PR company working with C-Suite clients in a fast paced environment where work priorities can change frequently, but in the end the work must get done. Responsible for supporting the operational effectiveness of the company, including scheduling, data entry, compiling reports, research and ensuring accuracy of all appointments. The successful EA will strategically coordinate the president's schedules, projects, and meetings to maximize his focus on top level matters. This position reports directly to the PRESIDENT of the company.

Responsibilities (including, but not limited to):

  • Scheduling for C-Suite clients and media outlets
  • Calendar management with a focus on keeping team current on the status of media appearances & interviews
  • Managing media lists and data entry within multiple platforms
  • Expense reporting
  • Event coordination and planning
  • Coordinating travel arrangements
  • Working closely with the president to streamline company processes and procedures

Requirements

  • 3 years experience and college degree
  • Polished and articulate phone and email communications skills
  • Tech savvy, with CRM management and remote working experience
  • Strong scheduling skills with unflappable demeanor
  • Exceptional multitasking and organizational skills, with high attention to detail
  • Proficient in Google Suite for calendar, email and document drive
  • Exercising professionalism under deadline pressure and ability to cross-team collaborate
  • High level of confidentiality and discretion
  • Must be able to work a flexible schedule in accordance with the media cycle (based on Eastern Seaboard). Can include early mornings, some late evenings and the occasional weekend

results.title: Junior Business Analyst
results.description:
We are looking for a Junior Business Analyst who will be the vital link between our information technology capacity and our business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of our software product’s features.

 

Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to revolutionize early years childcare and pre-schools communication and management solutions for good.

 

Job description

  • Analyzing business requirements to understand the business needs and to determine how systems and applications can best functionally fulfill those needs.

  • Collaborate with product development, marketing, and success teams to translate business into clear requirements.

  • Scheduling and leading requirements with stakeholders; gathering testable system requirements and translating them into and user stories.

  • Analyzing impact of the proposed solutions.

  • Develops business rules as well as supporting process flows.

  • Working closely with the Design team to provide the best user experience.

  • Writing clear and well-structured user stories, performs quality assurance, configuration assistance and application training.

  • Work closely with development teams to ensure that they understand and deliver the needed solution.

  • Gather users’ feedback for the implemented solution.

  • Have excellent communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills.

  • Bachelor¹s degree in Computer science, Information System or Engineering is preferred.

  • 1 to 2 years’ experience in business analysis & product ownership.

  • Experience in Agile methodology is a Must.

  • Certification in Agile methodology is preferred.

  • Experience in CRM’s and preferably within the education sector.

  • Very good at writing and speaking English.

  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
